nodes.text: flourishing economies can go hand in hand with environmental preservation
thriving economies and the preservation of ecosystems can be promoted simultaneously
the developed countries should support the underdeveloped areas by providing financial resources, technologies and experience
the environmental problems can be effectively alleviated in these areas
these needy countries lack adequate financial and human resources, advanced technologies and experience
they have to rely on natural resources to maintain their living standards
people in the poverty-stricken areas are not likely to be equipped with knowledge to preserve the ecosystems
the economic development and environmental protection can be conflicting
some countries may place economic developments ahead of environmental protection, thus ruining the local environments

With people raising their awareness of the green economy, the products free of pollutants are increasingly prevalent among clients, which means eco-friendly businesses can make a favourable impression on customers today, triggering sales
electronic bicycles powered by clean energy resources have been well received among people in recent years
the booming economy can be closely linked to the preservation of the environment
If a firm is environmentally conscious, it may have to make optimal use of its resources to improve its production lines and equipment, which can boost productivity

without the requirement of environmental preservation, the firm would still consume a vast amount of energy which constitutes a large part of its operational costs, being a hurdle to the economic develpment
taking environmental consequences seriously can enhance working efficiencies
it may spur its economic development
unchecked and reckless uses of the local raw materials may happen, which can put a strain on the natural resources
